TopicTitle: [STOCK] [Super-Detailed] WWII Era Vehicles (Latest: Supermarine Spitfire) [With BD Armory Variants]

Articles.Content:

You can use Firefox and Chrome, I am using Safari right now, but only because it hasn't peed me off yet since the last rebuild, I used Firefox too when things didn't work in Safari, people report Chrome as a resource hog on Mac.

Quick update: I fixed the glaring stability issues with all the planes (Shame on me for not testing fully) and added landing gear suspension which should help prevent bouncing off the runway on trying to land.

Cheers!

Another quick release - The P-38 Lightning will be next!

**LCVP - Higgins Boat**

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/qcm1E/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

LCVPs (Landing Craft, Vehicle and Personnel), were used to deliver troops by water, where they would be deployed from transport ships. The basic design and cheap materials made LCVPs straightforward and inexpensive to build. The ramp on this replica is fully functional and surprisingly robust - it uses [@Majorjim](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/61954-majorjim/)'s thermometer bearing. Use staging to detach the ramp, and when controlling the ramp use Action Group 1 to toggle the latch and pitch controls to raise or lower it.

Parts: 238

Mass: 18.1 tons

Cost: ![rwGmwPktxe9GN9sIWk4qgs7mx8kGM36BYxgXkPFcrPvMMOFmUS-llR98o0Huo9APlvB6MtXHhY5JC43mKP5FOyT7guTZTim5V__BhS316zEpYK4MhkNBDarF8mnSUmwNlYVsKHA](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/rwGmwPktxe9GN9sIWk4qgs7mx8kGM36BYxgXkPFcrPvMMOFmUS-llR98o0Huo9APlvB6MtXHhY5JC43mKP5FOyT7guTZTim5V__BhS316zEpYK4MhkNBDarF8mnSUmwNlYVsKHA)64388

**[Download](http://kerbalx.com/RixKillian/LCVP-Higgins-Boat)**

Enjoy!

Miller- "Move fast and clear those murder holes."  

Horvath- "I wanna keep plenty of beach between men. Five men, you use the opportunity. One man, it's a waste of ammo."

How did you do the coloring

From the OP: "Every craft is flyable without SAS (I never use it for any of these)"

Yep, i have the same bug. And usually SAS fracks more up than a few notches of trim, especially with engines that vibrate.

SAS also makes it a lot harder to maneuver I've found, especially with a joystick. It really fights your inputs ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, BT Industries said:
> 
> 
> How did you do the coloring
> 

With Kerbpaint - If you don't have it then the crafts will show up the stock colors when you download them so it doesn't really matter.
Thanks

Hello all! I'm back with another upgrade, and hopefully I can release some new planes over the next few weeks, now that the school year is wrapping up.

Right now in the R&D hangar I have an F4F Wildcat, TBF Avenger, P-38 Lightning, I-16, and a highly upgraded F4U Corsair (Very exciting, I know).

At the moment, however, I'm ready to release an upgraded **Supermarine Spitfire**!

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="https://imgur.com/a/EVWZq/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

While not the most numerous RAF fighter plane in the war, the Spitfire is arguably the most famous - Considered by some to be the quintessential British fighter.

With a top speed of 125 m/s, and fantastic control responsiveness, this is a plane to be reckoned with.

This replica is 1:1 scale, and includes functioning flaps and realistic control layouts.

**Take-Off Procedure:**

I've found the best way to take off is to lower the flaps and set full throttle, but don't pull up until the plane tips onto the main wheels and the tailwheel is off the ground. Then pull up very gently, and retract the gear and flaps.

**[Download](https://kerbalx.com/RixKillian/Supermarine-Spitfire-Mk-VI)**

Enjoy!

I apologize for the long absences, with summer coming I should be able to get back in the swing of things!
Can you please think abut adding a T 34  and a Is 2 that would be awesome.
